cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi (530 km) SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande / 235 mi (380 km) E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly north-northeast through Saturday, then expected to turn north and finally west toward the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay–Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northern Mexico to Louisiana, including the entire Texas shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Low (15%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; strongest gusts more likely north of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period swells building this weekend may lead to 2–4 ft water rises and minor coastal flooding around Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for prolonged heavy rain bands beginning late weekend; totals of 4 inches or more possible early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot transfers
